data.title: The Sharon Herald
data.meta_description: Dorothy Fike passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Sharon Herald on 2011-09-13.
data.text: Dorothy M. Fike, of St. Paul’s, West Salem Township, formerly of 2005 Shadyside Drive, Hermitage, died at 9:50 p.m. Saturday in St. Paul’s following a long illness. She was 86. She was born June 18, 1925, in Sharon to the late Albert and Susan Sholtis Hetsun and was a 1943 graduate of Sharon High School. Dorothy was a former 35-year member of Oakland Avenue United Methodist Church, Sharon, and a current member of Hickory United Methodist Church, Hermitage, where she had served as a counter and a member of the women’s society. She was also a member of the Order of the Eastern Star Chapter 242, Sharon. She also enjoyed sewing, reading and many other activities in St. Paul’s. She and her husband loved to camp and were members of the National Camping Travelers. Dorothy worked as a payroll clerk in the former Sharon Transformer Division of Westinghouse Electric Corp. and retired from Hickory High School, Hermitage, where she was secretary to the principal for 23 years. She married Robert W. “Bob” Fike Jr., on Sept. 11, 1948. He survives. Also surviving are her son, Dennis R. Fike and his wife Vicki, Hermitage; her brothers, Eugene A. Hetsun and his wife Josephine, Uniontown, Ohio; and Leonard G “Jerry” Hetsun and his wife Helen, Hubbard; and her grandchildren, Justin Fike, Scott Schafer, Brittany and Taylor O’Brien and Jennifer Prezgay. She will be missed by Remington “Two Paws,” her son’s Labrador puppy; and the staff at the Villas at St. Paul’s who became her second family. She was preceded in death by her parents and daughter, Darlene Schafer. If desired, material tributes may be made to Hickory United Methodist Church. FIKE Mrs. Robert W. “Bob” (Dorothy M.), 86, of St. Paul’s, formerly of 2005 Shadyside Drive, Hermitage. Calling hours: Friends will be received from 4 to 7 p.m. Wednesday (9-14-11) in Harold W. Stevenson Funeral Home, 264 E. State St., Sharon. Service: Fneral service at 11 a.m. Thursday (9-15-11) in Hickory United Methodist Church with the Rev. David S. Evans, pastor, officiating. Interment: Hillcrest Memorial Park. Arrangements by JOSEPH P. BRASHEN FUNERAL SERVICE, 264 E. State St., Sharon.
